member.name: T:CustomerList.frmCarInventory
member.summary: Author Name: Alfred Massardo and Tyler Segovia Project Name: CarInventory Date: 12-Mar-2019 Description Application to keep a list of cars and a little information that describes their importance.

member.name: M:CustomerList.frmCarInventory.btnEnter_Click(System.Object,System.EventArgs)
member.summary: btnEnter_Click - Will validate that the data entered into the controls is appropriate. - Once the data is validated a car object will be create using the - parameterized constructor. It will also insert the new car object - into the carList collection. It will also check to see if the data in - the controls has been selected from the listview by the user. In that case - it will need to update the data in the specific car object and the - listview as well.

member.name: M:CustomerList.frmCarInventory.Reset
member.summary: Reset - set the controls back to their default state.

member.name: M:CustomerList.frmCarInventory.IsValidInput
member.summary: IsValidInput - validates the data in each control to ensure that the user has entered apprpriate values

member.name: M:CustomerList.frmCarInventory.btnReset_Click(System.Object,System.EventArgs)
member.summary: Event is declared as private because it is only accessible within the form The code in the btnReset_Click EventHandler will clear the form and set focus back to the input text box.

member.name: M:CustomerList.frmCarInventory.btnExit_Click(System.Object,System.EventArgs)
member.summary: Event is declared as private because it is only accessible within the form The code in the btnExit_Click EventHandler will close the application

member.name: M:CustomerList.frmCarInventory.lvwCars_ItemCheck(System.Object,System.Windows.Forms.ItemCheckEventArgs)
member.summary: lvwCars_ItemCheck - used to prevent the user from checking the check box in the list view - if it is not in edit mode

member.summary: lvwCars_SelectedIndexChanged - when the user selected a row in the list it will populate the fields for editing
